segments.text: At the end of the week, she made her way home as usual by bus.
Dan was still in the field with the soldiers.
Already on the way, she felt weakness and chills.
Unlike her usual routine, she didn't immediately start cleaning the house.
Instead, she made herself a cup of tea and curled up in the armchair, barely able to lift her head, feeling the fever rising and realizing she was sick, deciding she'd better get to bed.
She forced herself out of the chair, left the dining room, crossed the path and went to her room.
She half removed her clothes, half let them fall off her.
Wearing only her undershirt, she got under the blanket.
Late at night, she woke up drenched in sweat, her head spinning.
She groped her way to the bathroom, washed her face a bit and took a pill from the cabinet behind the mirror.
Barely able to stand, she dragged herself back to bed.
Even though she was sweating, she knew she was burning up.
So, she returned under the blanket and sank again into a fitful sleep.
The next two days were mostly a blur.
She was supposed to return to the battalion, lost track of the days.

Occasionally, she found herself in the bathroom again, turning on the faucet, bending her head down and gulping water thirstily, trying to soothe the dryness and pain in her throat, and then crawling back to her bed.
The morning meeting on Sunday was supposed to start at 9 sharp.
But since she didn't arrive at the base, the commanding officer postponed it to 11.
At one, after finishing the meeting without her, he said to Dan, Listen, I'm really worried about her.
She always arrives before everyone, organizes everything.
She knew it was an important meeting, even though the operation was postponed.
It's not like her to just not show up.
Dan was even more worried.
It was unlike her, and he began to fear something had happened.
He tried to calm the voices in his head with the thought that maybe she just missed the bus that only comes every few hours.
But without the commanding officer knowing, he called from the switchboard to the pink house, and the dial tone rang on and on with no answer.
Now he was truly concerned.
Look, he said to the commanding officer, I'll wait another hour for the next bus, and if she doesn't arrive, I'll drive to her place and check what's going on.
You know where she lives?
The commanding officer was surprised.
Yeah, Dan answered casually.
I once gave her a ride.
Three hours later, he parked the Jeep at the entrance to the pink house.
He pushed open the dining room door.
It swung wide open, unlocked.
Only the shutters were drawn, and the room was dim.
He noticed the half-full cup of tea next to the armchair, closed the door, and made his way to the bedroom area to her room.
He knocked on the door, called her name, but got no response, pressed the handle, and the door opened before him.
A slightly musty smell was in the air.
His eyes adjusted to the darkness that greeted him and suddenly noticed the silhouette of her body on the bed and her foot sticking out from under the blanket.
He approached and saw her head in asleep days, her sweaty, tousled hair and the glass of water on the floor beside her.
He went to her and called her name again.
She did not respond.
He touched her forehead and immediately realized she was burning with fever.
He rolled up his sleeves and removed the blanket from her, noticing her thin body under the long tank top she wore.
He tried to sit her up in the bed, speaking softly to her, I must get you into the shower.
We need to lower your fever.
He slit his arm under her, helped her up, half carrying, half guiding her to the shower as her eyes alternately opened and closed.
He kicked off his shoes.
turned on the water with one hand, waiting until it was lukewarm, then stood her as she was, with her tank top on, under the water.
The water flowed over her from head to toe.
Slowly her eyes opened and her gaze cleared.
She stared at him in surprise, but did not resist his holding her under the water merely.
Whispered his name.
Dan.
You have a high fever, he explained.
We must bring it down.
After a few minutes, he turned off the water.
Gently and cautiously removed her tank top, averting his gaze.
It's not how we hope to see her naked for the first time.
He wrapped her in a large towel that hung there, and just as she was, completely wrapped, carried her back to the bed, covered her well, and saw her eyes close again in utter exhaustion.
He removed his shirt, wet from the shower, remaining in a white t-shirt.
His pants were also speckled with water droplets.
Now, with her asleep, he made his way barefoot to the dining room and made her a cup of tea with a slice of lemon in it.
Before returning to her room, an idea struck him.
He peeked at the address book on the reception desk, quickly found the doctor's phone number and called him.
Hello doctor," he said.
I'm calling from the pink house.
It seems the girl is very ill.
Been running a high fever for three days now and you should see her.
I'm coming right away," the doctor said and ended the call.
Within ten minutes he was at her bedside.
He spoke to her in English.
He was South African by origin and had treated her since she was three.
He also treated Lucy until her last day.
Abe, she whispered to him.
Hey, we'll take care of you properly.
Why didn't you call me right away?
I didn't have the strength, she whispered.
Well, at least someone had the sense to give you a cold shower and bring down your fever a bit.
You need antibiotics, but before that you must eat something.
I'll give you a shot and the rest you'll continue with pills.
He looked at Dan and gave him instructions, understanding he was taking charge at the moment.
He had no idea who he was, but he saw his shirt with Captain Stripes, thrown on the nearby chair.
Understood he was probably a friend from the army, and in any case, he seemed to care about her.
He padded her hand and noted to Dan that it would be wise to air out the room a little.
I'll return in the morning," he said, and went on his way.
Dan went to open the window, letting fresh air into the room, then sat on the edge of the bed and gently stroked her face.
She opened her eyes and looked at him with clouded eyes.
Thank you," she whispered.
He continued to caress her, his heart going out to her, looking at her tenderly and seeing how she drifted back into her restless sleep.
He left her room for the reception desk to call the commanding officer.
She's very ill, he reported to him.
A doctor has already been here and she's being treated, but I'll return only tomorrow.
She can't be left alone.
He spoke briefly as usual without providing too many details.
Only the tone of his voice when he said she can't be left alone was slightly softer than usual.
On the other end of the line, the commanding officer replaced the phone on its hook.
He wondered, what does it mean to leave her alone?
Where is her father?
And how come Dan stays with her?
And since when is he so sensitive?
And altogether, how does he know where she lives?
The story about giving her a ride was beginning to sound like an unconvincing excuse.
He would have to look into the details more deeply when they returned.
Suddenly he recalled the warm glance Dan gave her when they arrived to visit in the field and how he gently held her to help her get onto the Jeep.
What a fool I am, he thought.
The guy is in love with the mysterious girl no one knows anything about.
And maybe, maybe he already knows something.
In the end, he stayed two more days.
Two hours after the doctor left, his wife arrived at the pink house with a pot of hot chicken soup.
She had a heavy accent.
And after two words in Hebrew, she switched to English.
She laughed and said it was according to the doctor's orders and wanted to make sure the girl was OK and that he was taking care of her.
He had to give her something to eat because the doctor thought she hadn't eaten in two days.
Dan promised he would feed her.
Are you her friend?
She asked with.
A certain degree of curiosity.
Yes, I'm her friend, he answered determinedly.
Liking the sound of declaring it for the first time.
Proud of the new title.
Good, she said.
She needs looking out for.
She deserves it.
We've loved her since she was little.
She's a special and brave girl.
He remembered that this was the thought that came to him when they were in bait yanai, that she had a lot of courage.
He wasn't sure he fully understood why or what it entailed, but he knew the doctor's wife was right.
He thanked her greatly and promised again he would feed the girl.
By the next day she felt much better.
She entered the shower without help, scrubbing herself from head to toe, washing her hair thoroughly, letting all the clinging feverish sweat be washed away with soap and water.
Afterwards, she wrapped herself in a large fresh towel he had placed on her bed, gathering her hair in a small towel to form a kind of turban and emerged from the shower that way.
Dan took advantage of the time to remove the sheets from her bed and will place them with clean ones he found on a shelf near the kitchen.
She was grateful to him, but more than anything realized that although she was supposed to be ashamed, she felt neither shame nor embarrassment in front of him.
She understood he had seen her naked, helpless with a high fever, had smelled her sweat, wrapped her body, laid her in bed, and caressed her face for long periods.
He fed her from a spoon into her mouth like feeding a baby, and ensured she took the medication the doctor left.
And if that wasn't enough, every time she opened her eyes, she saw him dozing on the chair beside her.
Until at some point, she sent him to sleep in the next room, assuring him she was okay.
Now he greeted her with a happy smile as she re-entered her room.
He was also clean and had changed into clean jeans and a tank top he had in the Jeep.
She returned him a warm and gentle smile, feeling more than anything that she wanted him to wrap her now in his arms.
She approached him, laid her head on his shoulder, and allowed him to wrap his arms around her.
This is much better, he said.
For a moment you really scared me.
He released the towel from her head, letting her long hair fall onto her back.
You smell wonderful, he said, nestling his nose into the hollow between her head and shoulder.
They slipped into a gentle and slow dance of affection, of caressing.
looking deeply into each other's eyes, tenderly.

Then, as if by itself, the large towel slipped and fell from her body, and she stood before him naked, not covering anything, not instinctively moving to hide something, simply standing there before him almost proudly, naked and serene, aware that all shame or embarrassment had left her, feeling only joy at the look she saw in his eyes, never had she stood like this before anyone.
He examined her body with a soft gaze and told her,
But a moment later, he reached out one hand, just one, and gently stroked her head.
Right there, she thought, against all that was called for, he did not reach out to her breast, did not pull her to him, just created a tender and moving moment with the stroke of her head.

She took a small step towards him, laying her head again on his shoulder, and felt how the dance of passion, which had been held between them for long weeks, began until it was allowed to burst forth when she felt secure and ready for them.
Their gentle dance of affection accelerated, grew tumultuous, and became full of power and emotion.
He kissed her with a moist kiss, and she clung to his lips, not knowing herself.

They found themselves on her narrow bed, tangled with one another, their hands grasping one another, their legs entwined, their movements repeating, rising and falling, their breathing becoming heavy, both emitting sounds of moans and.
size, and suddenly their breath was taken, and they collapsed onto each other in boundless pleasure.
For long moments they lay unmoving, in utter exhaustion, in great happiness, looking at one another, diving deep into each other's eyes, and so loving what they found there.
He reached out and stroked her face.
God, he said.
This is what I hoped and waited for during weeks.

She returned the caress, slightly ruffling his curls, touching the worry lines between his eyes and moving to the laughter lines beside them, slowly bringing her lips to his mouth, giving him a long and wet kiss.
feeling his body stirring again towards her body, insatiable.
Again, they danced the wonderful dance of tenderness, touching hidden corners and awakening points she didn't know existed.

Her head was spinning and not from weakness, and there again she heard as background music their deepened breaths until their breath was taken again and they collapsed in a shaking release onto each other.
After a long pause, they covered the few steps to the shower.
Both stood together under the running water.
He gently washing her, sopping her body, and she laughed.
This is beginning to be our usual place.
Just lucky I'm fully conscious now.
and in her heart she thought, God, how pleasant this is.
Now they switched and she scrubbed his body.
We need to come out of here the cleanest.
He said with a smile and slowly without feeling it, the dance of tenderness touches, breaths and sighs began again between them.
She was gripped in his arms, holding on to him with her legs.
Her head tilted slightly back, hearing him whisper soft words in her ear.
hearing that same music of both of them and in one moment soaring, flying high.

He held her tightly, leaning on the shower wall, looking at her with sparkling eyes and gently set her back to slide down over him, placing her back on her feet as a quiet silence of happiness enveloped them.
They dressed in silence, occasionally sending a warm and smiling look at one another.
At one point he reached a hand to her cheek, half cupping, half stroking in a gesture full of emotion.
They made their way to the kitchen.
She hadn't been this hungry for a long time, as though her body that had recovered against the one that had awoken to a sensory experience she hadn't known was asking for food to strengthen.
He too was hungry, having barely eaten during the past two days there.
He helped her in the kitchen and set the table with bread, cheese, and chopped vegetables.
They ate with great appetite, not saying much, only exchanging warm looks.
wondering about the magical moments they had experienced, trying to determine for themselves what it meant, and deep down knowing this is called love.
Before starting their way back to the base, she clarified to him that she had to stop at the offices of Afridar, the housing company of the entire large neighborhood, also named as such.
He stopped near the clock tower in the center.
Everything was beautifully and thoughtfully built.
The large lawns that spread all around reminded him of neighborhoods from his childhood in the United States.
It might take some time, but it's very important, so please be patient, she requested.
Every second person she passed greeted her with a smile.
Some even hugged her warmly.
A small town, a bit like a village, he thought, wondering what she was doing there in such a business meeting.
And she, despite the desire to share, still hesitated, still kept from him the state of the pink house, her condition.
Not yet.
She told herself.
Not sure how he would react when he understood what she had taken upon herself.
It was quick.
Claude was available and received her warmly with the same kisses on both cheeks.
Not before checking she was eating and everything with her was okay.
She left the rent check in his hands, thanked him and left.
Near the jeep she found Dan talking to the doctor who had just left the clinic also located in that building.
They were smiling, looking like old friends, and their smiles widened when they noticed her.
Here's our healthy girl, said the doctor.
I need you to make sure you eat well.
This antibiotic weakens a lot, and even so, you're like a quarter of chicken, his Hebrew.
Accompanied by a South African accent was always cute to her.
In Afrodar, there were quite a few South Africans with a similar accent, and she was used to it.
After all, they established this neighborhood.
She glanced at Dan and caught him looking at her tenderly.
Don't worry, he assured the doctor.
I'll make sure she eats.
